Hi Rob and John.
Thankyou for your kind words. It is very unplesant to admi=
t that you have been cheeted like this. In these kind of matters, i.e. inte=
rnercriminality, the police work very slowly. The case has just reached the=
 USA Police. Too late to interfere and investigate the current episode on e=
bay where the auction were planned to close on th 19th. of May. I actually =
bought the sword and payed 3980 US dollars for it, but never received it. T=
herefore it belongs to me unless someone has bought it before I did.  Norma=
lly I am very carefully to get enough documentation for peobles identity be=
fore trading. Assumenly passport, driverslicense and NBTHK papers as well a=
s a lot of photos were not enough. Furthermore I don=B4t know whether someo=
ne else might have bought this beatyful sword before the date I bought it? =
Naturally I would prefer to get the sword but have realized that it might b=
e very difficult and that matters the money as well. But the sword are uniq=
ue, as all japanese swords are. In addition it has NBTHK paers and in my op=
inion it should not be impossible to find a former or maybe the current own=
er, if it is not me. Anyway I am happy to have prevented another one being =
cheeted and for the support from the group where you not have heard from me=
 yet. IAs I mentioned I have photos of the sword and copy of the NBTHK  pap=
ers and if anyone interested and if it does not interfere with the policy o=
f this group, I can publish it. My plan is to get in contact with worldwide=
 clubs and NBTHK as well and ask peoble if they know anything about this sp=
ecific sword. To you John, I am most happy that you stopped the payment in =
time. I have noticed that the seller has stopped the auction as well. I wou=
ld appreciate so much if you could mail a copy of what you have of any corr=
espondance or photos. Off course not any private informations. Then I will =
add this further information to the police.
Thankyou for your support.
All =
the best
Allan

When I have come through this awful case I will join the li=
st more. I have some intersting swords and tsubas as well. I always enjoy a=
nd learn from the discussion on this group.
  ----- Original Message ----- =

  From: John Berta 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Tuesday, M=
ay 18, 2004 4:56 PM
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Bying on ebay. Don=B4t ge=
t cheeted.


  Hi Allan;

  Sorry to hear about your problems.  This sort o=
f fraud causes every collector nightmares.

  Do you own this sword or did =
you buy it and not have it shipped?

  John
    ----- Original Message ----=
- 
    From: Allan Schrattenholz 
    To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com

 Sent: Tuesday, May 18, 2004 5:33 AM

    At present you can find a Kiyosada japanese=
 Sword with NBTHK papers 
    for sale on ebay. I bought this sword the 21t=
h. of february 2004, 
    payed it but never received it. By request I rece=
ived several other 
    photos of the sword and the NBTHK papers as well as=
 copies from his 
    passport and driverslicense. This information is avai=
ble for the 
    list if you don=B4t find it inconvenient. Look well at thi=
s sword on 
    ebay and take care of wolflady 137 and jnetweb as well as J=
ohn 
    Pivec, Minneapolis, USA. This sword will without any doubt be put =

    for sale again. If anyone has this sword in their possession, please 
=
    let me know. I will award informations which will place the sword at 
 =
   my house with 1000 U.S.dollars. If the Nihonto study group find it 
    =
appropiate I will put photos of the sword as well as John Pivecs 
    passp=
ort and driverslicense, on the list. 
    The Danish Criminal Police, The D=
anish Foreign Ministry and the USA 
    Police are involved in the investig=
ation and I have asked ebay to 
    help with information as well.
    Than=
kyou for your help in advance
    All the best
    Allan
